WorkItem.ClosedComment: Upon further inspection, we realized that this is actually by design.  DataGrid.CurrentItem is designed to give the value of the keyboard-focused element.  If you move focus to outside of the DataGrid, then this no longer returns a value.  If you are looking for the value of the currently selected item in the collection, you should use DataGrid.Items.CurrentItem.  Thanks!
WorkItem.Description:
Dear,
 
The annexed file demonstrates that 'datagrid.CurrentItem' and other related information is not available
when user clicks on TextBox besides the datagrid.
 
Thanks,
 
Julie
 
Procedure
------------
Unzip annexed file
Start Visual Studio 2008 and adjust the reference to 'WPFToolkit.dll' (I used v3.5.40128.1) in the  solution project
 
Scenario
----------
Start Application 
Step 1:
Click on cell 'A' in the datagrid: the 3 textboxes display information about this cell and related item.
Step 2:
Click in any of the 3 textboxes: the information has disappeared.
Step3:
Tab now from the Textboxes into the Datagrid (to obtain focus): the information appears again.
 
Conclusion:
Either a bug or information is  'datagrid.currentItemWhileDataGridHasFocus'
WorkItem.Summary: Datagrid : 'datagrid.CurrentItem' information disappears when focus outside datagrid

Comments.Message: Thank you for reporting this issue.  We've filed a bug to track this internally.  As a workaround, you can bind to DataGrid.Items.CurrentItem instead of CurrentItem and I think this will give you the same value in most cases.
How can I then bind to the current item?
